thread.title: Police unable to save man in N. Portland who suffered 'traumatic injuries'
thread.title_full: Police unable to save man in N. Portland who suffered 'traumatic injuries' | OregonLive.com

author: Jeff Manning | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Police unable to save man in N. Portland who suffered 'traumatic injuries'
text:
Police respond to the scene of a North Portland homicide Monday night in the 5500 block of North Columbia Court. Jeff Manning/The Oregonian/OregonLive It's shaping up as a bloody autumn in Portland.
Portland police are investigating the death Monday night of a man who suffered traumatic injuries and was found bleeding outside a building north of Columbia Boulevard. It is the fourth homicide in the city since Friday, the sixth in just over a week.
"That's a lot of violent crime we're responding to," said Pete Simpson, Portland Police spokesman.
Seventeen police units responded to the scene at 7:22 p.m. at the 5500 block of North Columbia Court on reports of an injured person.
They found a man who had suffered severe injuries, though Portland police spokesman Sgt. Pete Simpson said the man hadn't been shot.
Emergency responders administered medical aid but were unable to save the man, who died at the scene. Simpson said the medical examiner will conduct an autopsy Tuesday to determine the cause of death.
Simpson said police had not yet identified a suspect.
Police did not immediately release the name of the victim or his age, saying only that it was an adult man.
The crime scene is affecting neighborhood traffic in the area, police said. Motorists should use routes away from the area.
-- Jeff Manning
503-294-7606, jmanning@oregonian.com
